text.p: XOX Corp said Monday Lawrence McGraw resigned as president, chief executive officer and acting chief financial officer and as a member of the board of directors.
Pradeep Sinha, a co-founder of XOX, will serve as president, chief executive officer and chief financial officer until the board completes its search for a new president, the company said.
Sinha said McGraw and the company "came to the mutual decision that our intensified focus on the geosciences industry will require a different skill set."

Concurrent with McGraw's departure, XOX also said Steve Mercil and Dirk McDermott have joined the board of directors. They replace McGraw and John Swanson, who voluntarily resigned to maintain an odd number of board members, as required by the company's bylaws, the company said.

Mercil, who was elected acting chairman, is Equity Fund Manager of Minnesota Technology Inc. McDermott is the president of Altira Group, LLC, a venture firm focused on exploiting the investment opportunities of high technology in the search for and the production of petroleum and natural gas, where he manages the Altira Technology Funds.
